thread.title: Google reportedly cancels Pixel Tablet 2 - Times of India
thread.title_full: Google reportedly cancels Pixel Tablet 2 - Times of India

author: TOI Tech Desk
title: Google reportedly cancels Pixel Tablet 2 - Times of India
text: Google has reportedly canceled the development of its highly anticipated Pixel Tablet 2. This move has sparked speculation about the company's future plans for the tablet category.According to a report by Android Authority, Google has decided to redirect its tablet team to focus on other projects, effectively shelving the Pixel Tablet 2. This isn't the first time Google has abandoned a tablet project; the company previously canceled the Pixel Tablet in 2019.The Pixel Tablet 2, initially slated for a 2025 release, was set to leverage Google's powerful Tensor G4 system-on-chip, the same processor powering the Pixel 9 series. In contrast, the Pixel Tablet 3, rumoured for a 2027 debut, is expected to feature the advanced Tensor G6 chip. Given this timeline, it seems unlikely that Google would have initiated development on the Pixel Tablet 3 while its predecessor, the Pixel Tablet 2, was still in its prototyping stages.While the reasons behind this decision remain unclear, it's possible that Google is facing challenges in competing with established players like Apple and Samsung in the tablet market. The company may also be prioritising other product categories, such as smartphones and laptops.Meanwhile, there are growing speculations about a potential merger between Chrome OS and Android. This strategic move could be Google's response to Apple's dominant iPad, aiming to enhance competitiveness in the tablet market. Such a merger could pave the way for exciting innovations in the future of Google's tablet offerings.
